newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's Telstra in global alliance talks.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's Telstra in global alliance talks.

text.p: Australia's largest telecommunications group, the state-owned Telstra Corp, said on Friday it continued to have talks with other large telecommunications players about forming global alliances or joint ventures.

"Telstra continues to pursue discussions with significant telecommunications, information and technology players with a view to forming global co-operative arrangements such as alliances or joint ventures," Telstra said in its first half results statement.
"Geographically, Telstra continues to seek value creating opportunities in Asia which align with its international strategy," it said.

Earlier, Telstra reported a fall in net profit for the six months to A$742 million from A$1.205 billion in the previous comparable period. But this included a A$1.026 billion abnormal loss because of redundancies and restructuring costs. Operating profit rose to A$2.12 billion from A$1.85 billion.
Last week newspapers reported that Telstra Corp had been in talks with British Telecommunications Plc to forge a global alliance.

The reports said a deal between Telstra, BT and its United States merger partner MCI Communications Corp would have major competitive implications in Australia's telecoms market, which is to be deregulated from July 1.
It also said Telstra was still involved in high-level talks with other potential partners, including U.S. information technology giant International Business Machines Corp.
BT deputy chief executive Alan Rudge said last week that the company was unlikely to buy a stake in Telstra when it was privatised.
In early December, the Liberal-National coalition government won parliamentary approval to sell one-third of Telstra in a plan expected to raise about A$8.0 billion for the government.
Under the legislation, foreign investors are limited to 11.7 percent of Telstra with no individual foreigner able to buy more than five percent.
Telstra also has an internet joint venture with Microsoft
